D2EYDQxgjwrXkVAucVTFqw.text: Good place for tea. This place specializes in tea brewing. Many kinds of tea, however, I don't really a tea person. For me tea is tea, nothing fancy about it. However, my wife, sister, sister in law and my brother are the tea junkies. Well, fortunately this place serves iced chocolate coffee, very nice. Can't comment on the tea but I like the ambiance and good friendly service.

U5QN_jszlefEML6ld-q0QQ.text: It was a pleasant Sunday afternoon over luscious seafood spread for high tea! Though it was relatively packed and noisy but the food made up for it! Every thing on the platter was delicious including the desserts so I'm definitely going back another time with my girlfriends!

AdLnwqpha2358IZ8uajPvw.text: 2 stars for the Service & Lychee tea.Met my long time friend who just got in town from Abu Dhabi. She suggested Arteastiq for tea originally but since we both had no clue where else we could go for lunch, I said maybe we can go to Arteastiq for lunch as well. Arteastiq is located on the 4th floor of Mandarin Gallery. I would have think a restaurant in such locale could not be too bad, of cos I was so wrong. Upon arrival, we were greeted by a staff. Ambience looked great. The staff suggested we girls to sit in the inner seating area since those by the windows have couches and lower tables; may be harder to eat a proper meal. I told the staff it was fine for us to take those tables next to the windows; I know my dear friend would be happier with a table with a view. I looked at the brunch menu and another larger meal menu. I did not find anything that was really interesting but decided to play safe and ordered the chicken and waffle. With the brunch special, I could get a specialty tea which I opted the lychee tea. My friend ordered some linguine with baby squid. She too ordered a lychee tea. When our tea came, we went wow!! Presentation definitely an A+, the taste of the tea is another A+!! There was a skewer of lychees, a pot of tea and some mini cookies. When our lunch came, I went Omg inside in a bad way. The chicken was all diced up and there was a hint of curry on them. My bad for not reading clearly, the Chicken & Waffle here is nothing like what a Chicken & Waffle should be in US. I got quite a shock and this dish was just a mutated form of the well-loved Chicken & Waffle back home. It was so heavy, and I still tried to eat the bizarre version of the chicken. I gave up half way. I sent a picture to a friend back in Atlanta, I told him that was my lunch - Chicken & Waffle. He texted back "Wth!"I balked at the pricing of the food here at Arteastiq. They are overpriced and the food is really just mediocre or in my case bad. Our clothing reeked of all the different scents collected from sitting too near the kitchen.This is at most a great tea lounge and the food here does not warrant that kind of money. I may come back for tea but never ever for food. Then again there are so many decent tea lounges in Singapore, I don't see myself ever be back here.

photos.caption: Photo of Arteastiq - Singapore, Singapore. Can't help but keep staring at the dirty floorboard :(
Photo of Arteastiq - Singapore, Singapore. Arteastiq's version Chicken & Waffle :O
Photo of Arteastiq - Singapore, Singapore. Lychee Tea

vd3wsQSanbWDu2staS9png.text: Wife and I came here because Lady Iron Chef recommended this place. Despite the 3 star average review, our overall impression of this place is as follows.Atmosphere: 4.5It's pretty cute and well decorated. It has a lot of props with a combination of an european, Asian twist to it.Service: 2Wait time for seating is pretty long even though we were the second party waiting outside for a seat. I think it had a lot to do with people just taking their time (both customers hanging out and chefs/servers taking forever to serve food). We ordered 2 dinner entree and the first one came after 20 mins and then we finished it and between the second entree it took another 20 mins for the second entree. Yet, we still haven't gotten our drinks.Food: 4We ordered the Prince of Monte Carlo-Short Rib sandwich. It was super yummy (5 stars). And we also ordered the Boston Love Boat Ciponio, i thought it was just okay (3 stars). There was a lot of shells, soup was decent, average. Wasn't bad, but wasn't wow either. Both the dishes came with sweet potato fries which was really good. But we could only have so much.Overall I think this place is more like a 3.5-4 stars max. While they have something unique going on as well as decent food, they really need to work on their turnaround time. It's ridiculous for anyone to wait so long for a small tea pot (2 cups) even if they're here to kill time. The table next to us was complaining about waiting over 30 mins and I can tell they were super impatient and annoyed.

photos.caption: Photo of Arteastiq - Singapore, Singapore. Next table abandoned most of their tea
Photo of Arteastiq - Singapore, Singapore. Lychee tea was good
Photo of Arteastiq - Singapore, Singapore. Boston Love Boat Ciponio

8ME5FdHJ_aDLdIagBDgROQ.text: Arteastiq is tucked away in a quiet corner of Mandarin Gallery. It first started as a tea and furniture store but has now ventured into Art Jamming aka Social Painting. Well that's if painting with friends is up your alley. They would probably have to pay me to paint instead. Chill out on their comfy colored plush chairs and order yourself a tea concoction. I love those that are paired with alcoholic gelato. They are to die for plus they also come in these really interesting cups/glasses/bowls that you have to mix around. I never knew what i'm supposed to be doing with them other than to drink from it. Skip their tea sets, it is absolutely not worth trying even though it's not pricey. Instead, you may want to try their steamed apple/pear pudding. It's not fantastic but remember you're paying for the ambience than for the food.

photos.caption: Photo of Arteastiq - Singapore, Singapore. tea with alcoholic gelato

sbpbVAKeAVsmN9AkqpJ3MQ.text: Had dinner at the Mandarin  with 3 of my friends because they were having a 1 for 1 main-course deal on the Entertainer App. They had a separate area where people could do an Art Jam. Probably would try that sometime. The atmosphere was okay, food taste alright but portion was really quite small. They don't serve drinking water by the way. Bottled water was priced the same as their tea menu. ugh..What really made us disgruntled is the poor service. Very very slow, unresponsive and servers are obviously untrained. Nobody seems to know what good service is.

0aOEjA_9SBX8S03Oq8Fg_A.text: I enjoyed myself the first time I was here. But today was terrible. Not only did they not have any chai lattes, they refused to serve hot water unless we paid for it. Only upon indicating that their hot chocolate was too sweet, did the waiter serve the hot water but with sending off one remark, which was "this is the last time which we will be serving hot water" Well, this may also be the last time which I may come here. The teas are not exactly cheap at $11 per pot. Really nice ambiance but having service staff providing such remarks is uncalled for.

photos.caption: Photo of Arteastiq - Singapore, Singapore. Ginger milk tea at arteastiq

j7-ldetQYZt-00CJsSiiZw.text: The deco and furniture are really fancy. The price for tea set is slightly steep for what it is, but the innovative ice tea treats are refreshing. (Ice cream on pear tea? Yum.) You really pay for the ambience. A nice place to catch up with girlfriends. Guys might feel out of place here with all the feminine layout of the place.

photos.caption: Photo of Arteastiq - Singapore, Singapore. The tea came with delicate biscotti slices. Goes well with the light tea
Photo of Arteastiq - Singapore, Singapore. Pear tea in fancy teapot.

_fmXt5d3vxpp-KYHFEIslQ.text: Came here for a date during public holiday and I was amazed by the beautiful interior. Location:Nicely located in the middle of orchard road so it's definitely 5 star location-wise.Food:Meh! Don't bother to order appetiser or even mains. Food's overpriced and tasted horrible. The food presentation was nice to upload on Instagram but that's it. So it's only worth to order if you love taking good looking food and upload it on Instagram (hoping to make your friend jealous).Tea:Nice huge selection of iced teas and some great tea-flavored ice creams so I guess it's their specialty? I'm not a big fan of hot teas in the humid Singapore, so it's a good point that they serve delicious iced teas. Thus, I prefer this place over TWG. Ambiance:Great! Nice decor and comfortable seatings. Very conducive for intimate meeting with friends/partner.Price:Not affordable but reasonable considering the comfort level and location.PS: although they don't serve free hot/cold water but they allow you to get your tea pot refilled (TWG does not allow this). I would've given it 5 stars if the food was good and I couldn't rate it below 4 stars because of those alluring iced tea collection!!!

LXTiomwrLpddmXOyP2m3Dw.text: I have always wanted to check out this place for hi-tea (ever since a year ago) as I have heard good stuff about it. It has a half-art-studio-half-tea-lounge concept. But somehow the two parts felt very disjointed. Ambience: Was here on a Monday afternoon ... And so the crowd was mainly tai tais (rich housewives), their daughters and some solo book-readers (prob writers trying to get inspiration). The tea lounge is really nice - posh in a quaint and elegant manner (pastel colours, Victorian style furniture and jazzy music in the background).Tea: had its wolfberry and longan tea set which came with a mini biscotti and small mochi - very delightful presentation which transformed the tea experience to an all-new level.Food: I had some beef and chicken from one of the meat dishes my mum ordered (can't remember the name) - horrible horrible meat - too overcooked, not juicy at all and not flavoured enough. This place is obviously not known for its food ...I would come back here for a quiet afternoon with friends (or my mum again) over tea ... but not for its food.

BsekD3K69889Z92e-3EqUQ.text: Arteastiq is the place to be if you are looking for a nice place located at Mandarin Gallery to catch up with your friends over some light meal.Last year, i found this place last year when I bought some high tea set meals coupons from Groupon. Check out the place and has been a place that I would go to in orchard if my friends want to catch up with friends over some light meals and tea. Love to try out many of their interesting tea and ice cream selection.  Food wise, I love the creativity and effort put in their food presentation but would have appreciate the food quality was a tad better.Oh yes.. I haven't checked it out for myself but they do have Art Jamming sessions there too!

G3eXN7daEVUMhhCyKLrk3w.text: I must admit that I heard countless comments from friends raving about their unique experience at Arteastique. Most of them went for the Art Jam (social painting and tea), coupled with some random experience at the dining section.For me, I was more keen on the Art Jam session. I made a reservation online (dropped them an email) and got no reply whatsoever for 3 days. After which, I decided to call in and make my reservation instead. I highlighted to the lady over the phone of my email reservation and she seemed unaware of it. I wonder, who is manning the email inbox? If no one is manning the reservation email, then why provide an email address for reservation?Anyway, food was pleasant. Service was expected and really nothing more; what could be said of young servers who know nothing of providing good service?After dining, we went next door for our slated Art Jam session. The "lady" at the counter was pleasant and comprehensive. However, I was sorely disappointed with the guide for the Art Jam session. I paid $88 for a Sat, 6pm-9pm session and our guide was spending 80% of her time concentrating 4 others who obviously had bought the package of 10 art sessions. Seriously, is this how you treat potential customers? Giving them only a preview of your time while making them pay FULL RATE? A good, indirect marketing ploy to get one to sign up for their 10 session package - sign up or get 10% of guide time only!Only because I love painting and art, that I am sticking with the session. In the end, we couldn't finish our painting within 3 hours and had to schedule to come back again at $10 per hour! My goodness! Why? All because our guide spent all her time ensuring the 'package buyers' could complete their art on time, under her studious tutelege (90% of her time). Personality-wise, the guide took a while to warm up but was quite nice.Speechless.Try it if you are really short of things to do on a weekend.

34LyMDaF45v46gAClkeYdg.text: Not impressed.  Ordered the quesadilla.  Told the waitress to let the chef know that I would like it well toasted.  She said, "don't worry".  Really?  This is how you respond to a customer's request?  (You need training on how to speak to a customer.)  I think she was a manager of sorts too!  If the manager speaks like that to customers, there is no hope for the staff under her.Was told they do not serve water, so I had to order a $5 bottle of water.  I should have left then and there, but I was so hungry  You always know it's a bad sign when a restaurant whose cheapest main is $25 AND they don't server water.  Well, the quesadilla was served barely toasted.  Nothing like the picture advertised on their menu AND not what I had requested at all.  I tried to get the waitress's attention but she ignored me, so I just ate the soggy thing as it was served to me.  When I asked for the bill, the waitress did not even bother to ask me how the food was and she never thanked me for my payment.  Very bad service.  Terrible food. Overpriced.  Rude staff.I should have gone to Jone's the Grocer's which is next door.  I didn't see it as I came up the escalator.

H2G2tAxI7rkqX1l-FtothQ.text: What is with cafes/ restaurants not serving water? We asked them for a glass of water and they dont serve any?? The tea is on the pricey side but comes in a nice tray with some biscuits. I would go to some other tea place over this thou.

KtB6K3x_MPJ6fsuu22cdKw.text: Great ambience, tasty teas, OK serviceSeems to be a trend in Singapore- lackluster or inattentive serviceBut otherwise, Arteastiq has a fun, creative ambience, my Lady Lychee was very refreshing and tasty and the black sesame mochi was a cute touch
